text: Hello, Is there any problem with HubSpot? We have a problem with MACROS in our project since the morning. Everything worked fine yesterday
Same here <@UPHA2AUEM>, what's our case?

if you used any imports in your separate template partials/HTML files, then move them to the module.

We used separate files with macros to render components and from today these imports stopped working.
<@U011U4A6TNY> up :point_up:
Anyone from HubSpot Support team could jump in for a quick call?

from what i noticed there was a problem with the way of importing

this option doesn't work
```{% from '/public/components/icon.component.html' import Icon %}```
but this works
```{% import '/public/components/icon.component.html' as Icon %}```

very strange situation because there was no problem with this import
``` {% from ... import ...%} ```
for a year
thanks <@U011U4A6TNY> for your insights :bow:
Thanks <@U011U4A6TNY>! This "little" change caused a huge workload for us and a lot of stress
Any ideas if this is a planned action from HubSpot's side?
I wrote to support and i created ticket, but  i didn't get answer yet
I have the same issue. I also wrote a ticket to HubSpot. Waiting for an answer. If I receive answer faster I'll post it here.
<@UMXHBH6TC> we found a work around, check <@UPHA2AUEM> answer above :point_up:
<@U011U4A6TNY> any news from HubSpot Support?
nope

Hi - does any know if there is a way to exclude all css from an HubSpot form embed?
Even thought I set the form to raw html and set `css: ''` in the embed code I still get a series of styles being applied to form elements
Apparently not
well that needs to change immediately

Hey all, we have identified the issue on our end that caused the `{% from ... import ...%}`  to stop working when macros referenced other macros in the same file that weren’t explicitly imported. This should now be working and we are working on tooling to catch these kind of errors in the future. We are sorry for the inconvenience on this.

Should be able to use <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields/rich-text-editor|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields/rich-text-editor> for customization.

Hey developers, hoping someone can help me figure out what’s happening with the buttons on my theme. On every form button on my theme, there’s a strange icon/image that’s pushing the text out of the button. Here’s a screenshot of what it looks like:

Hey Melanie, if you have link to a page on your site where this is happening it might help others be able to triage the issue.

From just the image, my initial thoughts are that this may be a CSS issue.
Is there a recommended method for validating email addresses and phone numbers as “real” against third-party APIs during a form submission?
Thanks.

I would always recommend against this, it’s prone to issues and could mean you’re rejecting valid submissions.

Some products do validate MX records before submission, but this can be slow and isn’t guaranteed to work perfectly. MX records wont tell you an email address exists - but they will tell you that the domain is setup to receive emails. To know if an email exists you need to send an email to it.
